tasks.task: Setting up a drip irrigation system.
subtasks: Connecting the drip system to an outdoor spigot with a built-in back pressure valve.
Placing a screen filter to keep water clean and free of debris.
Installing a pressure reducer to lower pressure to 10 psi.
Attaching drip tubing to the mainline using adapters and T-tape.
Distributing water to plants using inline emitters and drippers.
Watering various crops such as beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, corn, and fruit trees using the drip system.
Using the system to water containers and raised beds.
Automating the system with a timer for efficient water usage.
Checking and cleaning the screen filter regularly.
Ensuring proper pressure settings (4-10 psi) for optimal performance.
Inspecting emitters and drippers for clogs or malfunctions.
Managing water flow to individual plants as needed.
Monitoring plant health and adjusting watering schedules accordingly.

tasks.task: Weed management using the drip system.
subtasks: Understanding how the drip system reduces weed growth due to targeted watering.
Manually removing weeds between drip-irrigated rows.
Saving water, money, and time compared to traditional irrigation methods.
Enhancing garden maintenance with low-pressure and easy-to-manage system.
